issues.description: The problem statement's Part 2 text requires a messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) method (including a double parameter and a specific "(volume: [milkVolume]L)" format), but the UML earlier in the same problem and both the template and solution use messageOnMilk() with no parameters. This is an internal contradiction in the specification and a cross-artifact signature mismatch: students following the textual instruction would implement a different method signature than what the template and tests expect, causing compilation failures or test mismatches.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the specification and code. Either (A) change the problem text in Part 2 to require messageOnMilk() with no parameters and update the descriptive example to "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (matching the UML, template, and solution), or (B) if the intent is to include milk volume, update the UML, template (calls to messageOnMilk), and solution to define messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and adapt all calls and implementations (including the Main loop) to pass a volume. Option A is the smaller change and preserves the current template/tests.

issues.description: The problem text (instructional paragraph) requires a method messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) that returns a string including the milkVolume, but the provided template and the reference solution use a parameterless method messageOnMilk() (and the UML in the same problem file also shows messageOnMilk():String). This mismatch between the problem description and the code artifacts creates a direct API/signature inconsistency: students may implement a version with a double parameter (following the textual instruction) which will not match the template/solution usage or tests that expect messageOnMilk() with no parameters.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the API across artifacts. Either (A) update the problem statement to describe the parameterless signature messageOnMilk() and example return value like: "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (matching UML and current template/solution), or (B) change the template and solution to define messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and update all call sites (e.g., Main and sing/usage) and tests to pass a milkVolume. Option A is the smaller change and recommended since the UML and current code already use messageOnMilk() without parameters.
